main event: An unusual object with above average speed and altitude was sighted, accelerating away at a fantastic speed.
interesting points: The object was very fast and bright, disappearing so quickly that it could not be observed in detail.
There was no noise or exhaust trail from the object.
The object was reported to be approximately the size of a large pea, well-defined, and of abnormal color with daylight brilliance.
The object came from the direct ahead position, flew in a level attitude, and was observed for approximately 1 minute.
The observer, Capt. John P. Ruppelt, was an experienced aircraft commander whose judgment was rated as reliable due to numerous shooting star sightings.
sighted object: an unusual fast and bright object
location: 350 mi W of Los Angeles, California
